review: I bought a streaming stick 95 days ago.  I loved it at first...so easy to stream from multiple providers, picture quality was great, things loaded quickly.  Then about two weeks ago, the remote stopped working.  I tried to re-pair the remote with the stick multiple times, but it wouldn't work.  I had to do a complete reset/factory restore on the system, but I was eventually able to get the remote to pair with it again and everything worked normally for a little while.Then, about 2 days ago, the remote stopped working again, and the stick would not connect to my wireless network (my wireless router is in the same entertainment center my TV sits on, so it's no less than 5 feet from the router).  I unplugged the stick, let it sit for a day, and again tried to pair the remote with the stick. Didn't work.  Tried reset/factory restore, the remote worked for about 5 clicks, then stopped working altogether.  And the Roku would not connect to the internet (it would connect to my wireless network, but not go any further, even though the laptop I am typing this on is connected to the same wireless network and connects just fine).The significance of the 95 days since I bought this unit is that the warranty is 90 days.It's a shame that such a great idea is so unreliable.  The stick itself feels cheap, like it could easily break in half.  I'm guessing the electronics inside are just as cheap.
author: Brian Chojnowski
